title: No transactions broadcast, with a sudden large txpool_queued spike, RPC timeouts
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.9.13
OS & Version: Linux

#### Expected behaviour
Transactions to be broadcasted, normal metrics seen for the amount of queued transactions in the pool.

#### Actual behaviour
Huge spike in queued transactions in the tx pool, no transactions being broadcasted, RPC `eth_sendRawTransaction` calls taking longer than 15s.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
No fixed steps on how to reproduce this issue unfortunately. The Geth nodes I've seen this issue occur on service a series of Chainlink nodes that don't incur much load on Geth. Requests ranging from `eth_call`, `eth_newFilter`, `eth_sendRawTransaction` and `eth_getBalance`.

Since the 5th of September, we've had this issue occur three times. What alerts us to it is timeouts upon the Chainlink oracle when sending a transaction (by default it's 15s). Although when it timeouts, geth reports that the transaction is already known, for example:
```
geth: WARN [09-16|21:01:52.776] Served eth_sendRawTransaction            reqid=83295   t=89.767µs            err="already known"
```

When investigating this issue further, the key indicator of the issue occurring is that the `txpool_queued` metric spikes to around <5k, while the `txpool_pending` metric drops substantially:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10528926/93395038-1b380000-f86d-11ea-8a88-333b334394e8.png)

With the above Geth instance, this metric pattern continued until we realised the issue and terminated it. Although, this happened to one of the other instances in the cluster, that eventually rectified itself:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10528926/93395241-723dd500-f86d-11ea-853c-764f59300268.png)

From delving into the logs of the Geth nodes and the Chainlink nodes that use them, there's is nothing strange in the logs during the times when the incident is occuring:

```

```

The above logs are taken from the time in the first screenshot, when the issue first started occurring. The `already known` errors are from the oracle trying to rebroadcast the transaction, to which it times out after 15s with Geth not reporting an error.

From investigating into other metrics, the only other signs are disk read stats and outgoing P2P traffic that drop suddenly at the same time:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10528926/93395797-76b6bd80-f86e-11ea-9ac3-a5c12934be06.png)

Considering the version of Geth we're running is old, is this a bug that's already been found & fixed? (Couldn't find anything in previous issues)

Also, I've been told that the exact same issue has happened with subsequent Chainlink oracle operators who are running 1.9.9-stable, with the same pattern seen with the pending and queued transactions.

**System information**
Geth version: 1.9.12
OS & Version: Linux

Thanks for creating this @jleeh, was just going to create one myself.  

We've experienced this issue multiple times too, on 2 separate Geth instances of ours. We're one of the Chainlink oracle operators Jonny is referring to.

**Actual behaviour:**

1. Our Chainlink node submitted a transaction to Geth that was included in block 10827268, with nonce 1738. https://etherscan.io/tx/0xbf7aeebd1ebe6574cfd38591249404f575cf2dfcc49f74a043eaa0ea03035577
2. An uncle was present in block 10827269. (not sure if this is relevant)
3. The CL node from thereon assumed 1738 was mined, so started sending tx nonces above 1738. However Geth responded that the previous 1738 was still queued "transaction already in mempool", so these subsequent transaction remained queued.

Txpool the moment it happened (executable - txpool_pending, gapped - txpool_queued, local - txpool_local):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20502751/93438528-b82a8580-f8cd-11ea-9eb5-ccf37bf06d48.png)

Resulting in the following txpool:


Data retrieved from node_exporter:

P2P upload rates and CPU usage also spiked downwards during this time:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20502751/93439009-4ef74200-f8ce-11ea-8505-9082bba19777.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20502751/93440889-e7da8d00-f8cf-11ea-93c6-dbe83868b8df.png)


Rate of system context switches went up (irate(node_context_switches_total[30m])):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20502751/93440445-b5309480-f8cf-11ea-8a9e-77643990a58c.png)

We did a large number of fixes, including in the transaction pool since your installed release. Please check how a recent release behaves, we don't want to debug something we might have fixed half a year ago. Please report how 1.9.21 behaves. Thanks
